headline: Sacramento State visits Weber State following McEwen’s 22-point showing
author: The Associated Press
sentences:
Sacramento State Hornets (6-15, 2-12 Big Sky) at Weber State Wildcats (18-8, 11-4 Big Sky)
Ogden, Utah; Thursday, 9 p.m. EST
BOTTOM LINE: Weber State faces the Sacramento State Hornets after Koby McEwen scored 22 points in Weber State’s 83-79 loss to the Idaho Vandals.

If you do not yet have a Torstar account, you can create one now (it is free)
Conversations are opinions of our readers and are subject to the Code of Conduct.
LAST 10 GAMES: Wildcats: 7-3, averaging 80.2 points, 29.5 rebounds, 11.6 assists, 7.6 steals and 2.5 blocks per game while shooting 48.8% from the field.
Hornets: 1-9, averaging 62.5 points, 27.7 rebounds, 11.8 assists, 5.9 steals and 2.3 blocks per game while shooting 43.2% from the field.
Sacramento State is 5-6 when it turns the ball over less than its opponents and averages 11.6 turnovers per game.

SHARE:
Anyone can read Conversations, but to contribute, you should be registered Torstar account holder.
William FitzPatrick is averaging 2.4 made 3-pointers over the last 10 games for Sacramento State.
Seikou Sisoho Jawara is averaging 15.8 points over the last 10 games for Weber State.
TOP PERFORMERS: McEwen is shooting 46.0% and averaging 17.8 points for the Wildcats.
Jamison Overton scored 18 points points to help lead the Wildcats to the victory.
Weber State is eighth in the Big Sky in rebounding averaging 30.8 rebounds.
Bryce Fowler is shooting 47.4% and averaging 17.1 points for the Hornets.
The teams square off for the second time this season in Big Sky play.
The Hornets have gone 2-12 against Big Sky opponents.
The Wildcats won the last matchup 79-59 on Jan. 30.
Their opponents have averaged 73.8 points per game.
Dillon Jones leads the Wildcats with 10.7 boards.
Their opponents have averaged 72.1 points.
The Star does not endorse these opinions.
The Wildcats are 9-4 in home games.
